attributes.action: Protect all in the UK from Covid,  must isolate regardless of vaccine status.
attributes.additional_details: Provide evidence that those not isolating are at any less risk of spreading the virus than those unvaccinated, when both must pass a test to show they are not infected.
attributes.background: Currently the isolation status of those vaccinated has been changed in some circumstances. Travellers who have had two vaccines do not need to isolate. As it is well documented that double vaccinated persons can still catch and spread Covid, we want independent evidence this is just and correct.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: 

Self isolation rules to be the same for both vaccinated and unvaccinated people:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/592748
